result.execSummary:
The defendant Laurie A Scoles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

DE will comply with/complete any programming recommended by DOC agent.  
DE to provide a DNA sample/pay surcharge.

Case settlement

Defendant Laurie A Scoles in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15FO160.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  15FO160 will be DRI.  15CF150-Ct 1 will be DRI.  Ct 2-enhancers will be dismissed.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 2.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, will withhold sentence, order one year probation, DE will comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent, provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge, CC.  DE to read victim impact statement.
Review hearing at 01-04-2016 01:00 pm

Defendant Laurie A Scoles in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15FO160.  State calls Deputy Michael Majeski, oath given.  Direct by the State.  Objection by Def, overruled.  Cross by Defense.  Witness dismissed.  State moves for bind over.  Court finds probable cause exists, will bind over for JT.  Information filed by the State, will proceed to arraignment, waive reading of info, enter plea of NG to all counts.  Set for RH 1-04-15 @ 1:00PM.
